1.name: Phase 1: Market Fit & Strategy
1.description: Establish the fundamental compliance challenges, unique security value, and EG's differentiation in the healthcare AI market.
1.contributors: Chief Medical Officer, IT Directors, Compliance Officers, Head of Patient Experience

questions.text: What specific pain point are we solving that the customer cannot efficiently address today?
questions.criteria: Lack of transparency in cloud AI, data sovereignty requirements, HIPAA/GDPR compliance risks, clinical staff frustration with information silo
questions.focus: Address cloud AI transparency risks and institutional clinical data sovereignty.
questions.hint_text: Explain why hospitals currently block AI adoption due to 'black box' processing. Focus on the compliance officer's inability to audit data flows in external cloud platforms.
questions.ideal_answer: Healthcare organizations are currently paralyzed: they need AI for clinical efficiency but cannot use cloud-based LLMs because data processing happens in opaque environments beyond their control. This creates a fundamental compliance gap where CISOs cannot verify that patient data isn't being used for training or leaked across jurisdictions. Our on-premise solution solves this by bringing the AI to the data, ensuring 100% sovereignty that no cloud provider can match.

questions.text: What measurable value will the customer realize, and how quickly?
questions.criteria: Time-to-compliance for AI projects, reduction in audit prep time, clinical search efficiency, avoidance of regulatory breach costs
questions.focus: Prioritize week-one compliance deployment over months of legal cloud reviews.
questions.hint_text: Mention how we enable AI deployment in weeks rather than months of legal review. Focus on the immediate availability of verified clinical protocols for staff.
questions.ideal_answer: Customers realize value within 14 days of deployment through the immediate activation of AI-powered clinical guidance that has already passed internal compliance audits. We typically see a 50% reduction in time spent by clinical staff searching for internal protocols and a 100% elimination of the 'shadow AI' risks that hospitals currently face. The financial value is anchored in avoiding multimillion-dollar HIPAA violations.

questions.text: Why is EG the right partner? What differentiates EG?
questions.criteria: Healthcare-specialized model tuning, verifiable local-only architecture, deep understanding of clinical workflows, audit-ready logging
questions.focus: Contrast local-only verifiable architecture with opaque external cloud service models.
questions.hint_text: Highlight our 'zero-leakage' architecture and our focus on medical-grade accuracy. Contrast this with general-purpose AI vendors.
questions.ideal_answer: EG is the only partner providing a medical-grade, audit-ready AI platform that resides entirely within the hospital's firewall. Unlike generic AI startups, we provide full transparency into our model weights and data processing logs, enabling your compliance team to independently verify every transaction. We combine deep healthcare domain expertise with cutting-edge local-inference technology.

2.name: Phase 2: Product & Experience
2.description: Define the technical integration, clinical user experience, and the security controls that build institutional trust.
2.contributors: Chief Medical Officer, IT Directors, Compliance Officers, Head of Patient Experience

questions.text: How does the solution integrate into their existing workflows and systems?
questions.criteria: Integration with EHR/EMR (Epic/Cerner), SSO alignment, internal network connectivity, local server requirements
questions.focus: Integrate within hospital private cloud using existing EHR system protocols.
questions.hint_text: Describe how we leverage existing hospital hardware (private cloud/air-gapped servers) and integrate with Active Directory for seamless login.
questions.ideal_answer: Our solution is deployed as a containerized application within the hospital's private cloud or air-gapped data center. It integrates directly with Active Directory for SSO and uses internal APIs to index medical protocols and policy documents. For clinical staff, the AI assistant appears as a secure tab within their existing EHR workflow or a dedicated internal portal, ensuring zero friction.

questions.text: What does the user experience look like for different stakeholders or personas at the customer?
questions.criteria: Physician search experience, Nurse protocol guidance, Compliance officer audit dashboard, IT admin management
questions.focus: Connect natural clinical query experience with deep compliance audit transparency.
questions.hint_text: Contrast the natural language query experience for clinicians with the detailed transparency logs provided to compliance and legal teams.
questions.ideal_answer: Physicians and nurses experience a highly responsive natural language interface for instant protocol retrieval. Compliance officers, however, have a dedicated 'Audit Vault' dashboard where they can trace every query and response to its source document. IT Admins manage the local model performance through a standard telemetry dashboard, ensuring system reliability without ever needing external internet access.

questions.text: What safeguards and controls give them confidence in the AI's outputs?
questions.criteria: Source attribution (RAG), Hallucination thresholds, HIPAA-compliant logging, local data isolation, verifiable model provenance
questions.focus: Ground AI responses in internal documents with direct clickable citations.
questions.hint_text: Explain how every AI response includes direct citations to internal hospital documents and how 'hallucination' is minimized by our RAG architecture.
questions.ideal_answer: Trust is built through our 'Citation-First' approach: every AI response is strictly grounded in the hospital's own verified documents, with clickable citations to the exact page and paragraph used. We implement rigorous 'hallucination filters' that prevent the model from answering if the information isn't found in the secure knowledge base. Furthermore, all logs are tamper-proof and stored locally for regulatory review.

3.name: Phase 3: Execution & Scale
3.description: Outline the path to enterprise-wide adoption, evidence of success in regulated environments, and the long-term support model.
3.contributors: Chief Medical Officer, IT Directors, Compliance Officers, Head of Patient Experience

questions.text: What does success look like at 90 days, 6 months, and 12 months?
questions.criteria: 90-day compliance sign-off, 6-month clinical pilot completion, 12-month system-wide rollout, KPI targets (accuracy, adoption)
questions.focus: Transition from security validation to enterprise-wide clinical protocol knowledge layer.
questions.hint_text: Describe the journey from initial security validation (90 days) to becoming the primary knowledge layer for the entire hospital system (12 months).
questions.ideal_answer: At 90 days, success is defined by full sign-off from Legal and Security teams after a successful audit of our local data processing. At 6 months, we achieve 80% adoption within two clinical departments. By 12 months, EG is scaled across the entire hospital system, serving as the trusted, secure knowledge bridge for all clinical and administrative protocols.

questions.text: What evidence do we have that this works for companies like them?
questions.criteria: Peer hospital references, specific HIPAA audit success stories, performance metrics (latency, accuracy), clinical validation studies
questions.focus: Validate success through Tier-1 hospital HIPAA audits and accuracy benchmarks.
questions.hint_text: Mention our deployment at a Tier-1 University Hospital where we passed a rigorous 3rd-party HIPAA security audit while serving 5,000+ staff.
questions.ideal_answer: We have successfully deployed at three major academic medical centers. At one Tier-1 University Hospital, our platform passed a comprehensive 3rd-party HIPAA security audit and now handles over 10,000 queries per month with 98% clinical accuracy. Our case studies show a 40% improvement in protocol adherence during the first six months of usage.

questions.text: How will we support them through adoption and scale?
questions.criteria: Clinical onboarding teams, technical support for local infrastructure, regular model fine-tuning, compliance update cycles
questions.focus: Support through clinical onboarding teams and quarterly medical guideline updates.
questions.hint_text: Describe our 'Clinical Champion' program and our commitment to providing quarterly model updates based on the latest medical guidelines and local data.
questions.ideal_answer: We provide a dedicated 'Healthcare Onboarding Team' consisting of both technical engineers and clinical informaticists. We offer 24/7 support for your local hardware infrastructure and provide quarterly model updates to ensure the AI stays current with the latest medical guidelines. Our Monthly Compliance Reviews ensure the system evolves alongside changing healthcare regulations.
